content: First, lets define what a bonus is: its a reward for managing a firm to increased production and profits for the company and its stock holders. Second, the CEO, Board of Governors and top management administrators do not own that company the stock holders do. All the stock these people hold were not bought or earned they were taken as a bonus (theft). Any monetary bonus awarded to top management in a company that is operating at a loss is nothing more than THEFT. This new administration should step in and police up this corruption. Make it a requirement that a bonus of any kind will not be awarded when a firm is operating in the red. Make it a Federal Offense when it is proven that a bonus was awarded because the books were 'cooked'. No fine and slap on the hand. Want to get their attention - A huge fine and manditory prison sentence.

content: Since the contracts were signed before the collapse, and they are going to people that had nothing to do with the CDS disaster they should be honored. Dropping them is like the government taking away reenlistment bonus payments. On my first reenlistment my career field was critically undermanned, and as an E-4 I reenlisted for 6 years with a $30,000 bonus. Half of it was paid up front the rest in annual increments. Four years later because of some unit closeures the same career field was overmanned, to the point some got hit with mandatory retraining, yet I was still getting annual payments on a bonus. Would it have been right for the government to tell me that since retaining me in the career field wasn't essential that they were just going to stop my bonus, or tax it at 90% to recoup the money.
